author: Karen Wilkin
title: ‘Mitchell/Riopelle: Nothing in Moderation’ Review: When Lovers Collide
text:
Toronto
In the summer of 1955, Joan Mitchell met Jean-Paul Riopelle in Paris, where the two ambitious, committed abstract painters were living and working. Mitchell (1925-1992) was beginning to be recognized in New York, while Riopelle (1923-2002), a Paris resident since 1948, connected with the Surrealists, was already fairly well known....
